snippet: Scientists are studying the DNA of the Del Sontro family for mutations or aberrations, hoping to see if genetics can explain why heart disease strikes apparently healthy people.
abstract: Massive government study led by Dr Leslie Biesecker is examining the genetic makeup of seemingly healthy people who suffer from heart disease, searching for telltale mutations or aberrations in their DNA that could be root of their affliction; Rick Del Sontro, whose entire family suffers from heart disease, is one participant in study (Series: Genetic Connections).
lead_paragraph: Scientists are studying the DNA of the Del Sontro family for mutations or aberrations, hoping to see if genetics can explain why heart disease strikes apparently healthy people.

headline.seo: Seeking Clues to a Heart Killer in the DNA Binding a Family
headline.main: Seeking Clues to Heart Disease in DNA of an Unlucky Family
headline.print_headline: Seeking Clues to Heart Disease in DNA of an Unlucky Family
